definition: to enter/to go into/to join/to become a member of/to confirm or agree with/abbr. for 入聲|入声[ru4 sheng1]

sentences.english: As dusk descends on the mountains, a pangolin emerges from its burrow.
sentences.chinese: 当薄暮涌入山区，一只穿山甲从地洞钻了出来。

sentences.english: It's a paradox that Hot Money rushed in online game industry.
sentences.chinese: 热钱涌入网游行业，这是一个矛盾的话题。

sentences.english: Waves could be seen splashing into city streets and over bridges.
sentences.chinese: 可以看到波浪涌入城市街区，甚至是溅到桥上。

sentences.english: No wonder 18 million tourists pile onto the floating city each year.
sentences.chinese: 无可惊讶的，每年一千八百万游客“涌入”这水都。

sentences.english: The move authorises funds and personnel to deal with the influx.
sentences.chinese: 政府还部署了资金和人力来应对人流的大量涌入。

sentences.english: One security guard used it as a shield against the torrent of people that streamed into the store.
sentences.chinese: 有个保安把该门板用作盾牌，抵挡涌入商场的人潮。

sentences.english: A report by Jiangxi Economic and Trade Department also shows the trend of an emulative inrushing of foreign investment.
sentences.chinese: 江西省经贸厅一份报告也显示了外资争相涌入的趋势。

sentences.english: A few questions thronged into my mind.
sentences.chinese: 几个问题涌入我的脑际。

sentences.english: Curious people streamed into the hospital Friday for a glimpse.
sentences.chinese: 周五那天，好奇的人们涌入医院只为匆匆一瞥。

sentences.english: The price he pays for the precious resource flooding his farm?
sentences.chinese: 他为这涌入其农田的宝贵资源付过多少钱？

sentences.english: The Turks began to pour into the Peloponnesos in some numbers.
sentences.chinese: 土耳其人开始大量地涌入伯罗奔尼撒地区。

sentences.english: The under compartments of the bow started to flood.
sentences.chinese: 船头的隔水舱以下开始涌入海水。

sentences.english: Thousands of refugees are packed into over-crowded towns and villages.
sentences.chinese: 成千上万的难民涌入拥挤不堪的城镇和村庄。

sentences.english: Fears of an invasion of "Polish plumbers" apparently turned out to be unfounded.
sentences.chinese: 对“波兰水管工”涌入发达国家的忧虑可谓杞人忧天。

sentences.english: Many people poured into South Africa for gold rush in the 19C.
sentences.chinese: 19世纪有大批的人涌入南非去淘金。

definition: to spill/to overflow (of water, crowds)/to crowd (into a space)
to gush/to gush out/to pour out
to emerge in large numbers/to spring up/to emerge prominently
to take in/to absorb/to admit/to accept
a steady flow (idiom); an unending stream
to flow back/reflux/circumfluence/refluence/backward flow/returning flow (e.g. of talent)
